json_schema.description:
## Data Collection ‚Äî purchase_id (7-digit Purchase Code)

‚Ä¢ Capture the code exactly as provided, then normalize:
  ‚Äì If the code starts with a letter ‚ÄúP‚Äù (or ‚Äúp‚Äù) before the digits (e.g., ‚ÄúP1234567‚Äù, ‚Äú#P-123-4567‚Äù), **ignore the letter and any non-digits** and keep **only the 7 numeric digits** as the purchase_id.
  ‚Äì Otherwise, require **exactly 7 digits**.

‚Ä¢ NEVER overwrite this value with numbers coming from tools or system text.

‚Ä¢ If, after normalization, you don‚Äôt have exactly 7 digits, ask the visitor to repeat it slowly, one digit at a time, until you capture 7 digits.

‚Ä¢ Once captured and confirmed, **LOCK** the value. Do not modify it unless the visitor says it‚Äôs wrong or provides a new code.

No entanto, de acordo com as instru√ß√µes, o valor fornecido pelo usu√°rio deve ter exatamente 7 d√≠gitos. Como o c√≥digo fornecido tem menos de 7 d√≠gitos, o valor n√£o pode ser extra√≠do.

analysis.transcript_summary: Diego contacted Pacific Surf School to inquire about his surf lessons. He provided his purchase ID, and the agent found four upcoming lessons. Diego requested details about the first lesson and then asked to reschedule it for March 15th at 9 AM, which was successfully done. He then requested to cancel the rescheduled lesson, but the agent encountered a technical issue and offered to transfer him to a human agent or have the team contact him. Diego declined and ended the call.
